Mana Generator$(/l)$(li)$(l:creatania:mana_su#bettermanufacturing)Better Manufacturing:$(/l)$(br)   Revised Steps 2-3$(li2)$(l:creatania:mana_su#bettermanufacturing)Liquiy Inert Corrupted Mana$(/l)$(li2)$(l:creatania:mana_su#purifyliquid)Purify Corrupted Fluid Mana$(/l)

Mana Generation is not a simple process, especially when trying to accomplish it with machinery instead of flowers. We have machinery capable of blowing and sucking air using fans, maybe if we aggregate enough air some of the magical nature present in it can be extracted, even if at a very low yield. Sadly after all our efforts, the best we could manage is to generate a fake version of it.

It looks like it is inert and somewhat corrupted, and to make matters worse it is... solid? What am I even supposed to do with that? Further experimentation is required, but we should be careful, these things look nasty and dangerous.

pages.title: Step 1: Mana Condenser
pages.text: After several failed attempts, we managed to create a $(c:/create ponder creatania:mana_condenser @a)Mana Condenser$(/c), which "condenses" mana from the air using only SU - unfortunately, the mana is corrupt. The Corrupt Mana Blocks are inserted directly into an inventory or on a belt, with available space, below the machine.

pages.title: Step 2: Purifying
pages.text: We then thought, what if we placed the Corrupt Mana Blocks around a $(c:/create ponder botania:pure_daisy @a)Pure Daisy$(/c)? It turns out flowers were the answer! The Pure Daisy seems to have removed all semblance of corruption from these blocks. These blocks are purified but seem to be still inert.$(br2)This thrilling discovery was
dampened when we found that leaving Pure Mana Blocks placed around a Pure Daisy causes them to turn into Corrupt Mana Blocks again.

pages.title: Step 3: Pure Mana Liquid
pages.text: We now had a "Mana" block that was safe to handle. However, we were still a long way from having usable mana that we could use to make Botania tools, weapons, and other magical items. To the touch, the blocks felt like gelatin. We knew if you heat gelatin, it liquefies. Would the same apply to Inert Mana Blocks?

pages.title: Pure Mana Liquid cont...
pages.text: To liquefy $(c:/create ponder creatania:mana/blocks/pure @a)Pure Mana Blocks$(/c) we placed them in a superheated Mixer and Basin producing Pure Mana Liquid. Now, we had lots of Pure Mana, but we still had no clue how to put this liquid into a Mana Pool. We needed to discover the secret of Botania Mana! Transforming Pure Mana Liquid to Real Mana Liquid happened by accident.
The details of this secret are guarded under heavy security.

pages.title: Step 4: Mana Generator
pages.text: Just kidding! No. Seriously, I am not revealing how the $(c:/create ponder creatania:mana_generator @a)Mana Generator$(/c) operates. When provided with rotational force, this machine somehow manages to convert the Pure Mana Liquid we've been handling into Real Mana Liquid, percolating it into a Mana Pool above it. This conversion process is inexplicably magical but it

seems to be woefully inefficient, only a fraction of the liquid that goes in is successfully transformed into real mana. Regardless, after much trial and error, we finally discovered the secret to “real” Botania mana or as we call it, Real Mana Fluid.

pages.title: Better Manufacturing
pages.text: To improve the manufacturing process, we modified steps 2 and 3.$(br2)$(l)Step 2: Liquify Corrupt Mana Blocks$()$(br)Placing Corrupt Mana Blocks around a Pure Daisy, then mining them when purified became very tedious! What if we could liquefy the Corrupt Mana Blocks as we did to the Pure Mana Blocks?

pages.title: Corrupted Mana Blocks
pages.text: Thankfully, $(c:/create ponder creatania:mana/blocks/corrupt @a)Corrupt Mana Blocks$(/c) can also be liquified in a superheated Mixer and Basin to produce Pure Mana Liquid - no more manually handling those corrupted blocks.

$(l)Step 3: Purify Corrupt Mana Fluid$()$(br2)The Pure Daisy is a miracle flower! We found the Corrupt Mana Fluid is also $(c:/create ponder creatania:corrupt_mana_bucket @a)purified$(/c) via the Pure Daisy to produce Pure Mana Fluid. We can easily pipe four buckets of Corrupt Mana Fluid around a Pure Daisy, although, I wonder if there is a way to have eight?
